body.name: The Adventures of Amina al-Sirafi: A Novel
body.description: Shannon Chakraborty, the bestselling author of The City of Brass, spins a new trilogy of magic and mayhem on the high seas in this tale of pirates and sorcerers, forbidden artifacts and ancient mysteries, in one woman’s determined quest to seize a final chance at glory—and write her own legend.Amina al-Sirafi should be content. After a storied and scandalous career as one of the Indian Ocean’s most notorious pirates, she’s survived backstabbing rogues, vengeful merchant princes, several husbands, and one actual demon to retire peacefully with her family to a life of piety, motherhood, and absolutely nothing that hints of the supernatural.But when she’s tracked down by the obscenely wealthy mother of a former crewman, she’s offered a job no bandit could refuse: retrieve her comrade’s kidnapped daughter for a kingly sum. The chance to have one last adventure with her crew, do right by an old friend, and win a fortune that will secure her family’s future forever? It seems like such an obvious choice that it must be God’s will.Yet the deeper Amina dives, the more it becomes alarmingly clear there’s more to this job, and the girl’s disappearance, than she was led to believe. For there’s always risk in wanting to become a legend, to seize one last chance at glory, to savor just a bit more power…and the price might be your very soul.Supplemental enhancement PDF accompanies the audiobook.PLEASE NOTE: When you purchase this title, the accompanying PDF will be available in your Audible Library along with the audio. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AN ADVENTURE FOR THE GIRLS
reviews.reviewText: I meant what I said. And I said what I said! So much action and awesomeness to behold. I powered through this book so fast I couldn’t put it down. If you are at all fans of pirates of the Caribbean or treasure island you’ll love this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Unexpectedly amazinger than expected lol
reviews.reviewText: Somebody on the Internet said to read this, I loved the cover and the blurb, so I read it. I think I was expecting more of a historical fiction type of book, based on a true story, and I have no idea why I was thinking that. I did love the historical side of it, since I rarely read books about that part of the world. I loved learning a bit about new countries and cultures and people, and I'm intrigued enough to read more if future books are forthcoming. Amina is a badA and I would love to have more adventures with her and see how she eventually settles her debt.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A grand adventure!
reviews.reviewText: This book is amazing. It feels like you are on the ship going on an adventure yourself while you read the book. I can’t wait to read more from Shannon Chakraborty!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It started out a little slowly but I kept reading and became vested in the story. If you give it a chance, I think anyone will enjoy the adventures. I am looking forward to the next story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rarity: A mature woman protagonist, 12th century Indian Ocean/Islamic peninsula
reviews.reviewText: Adventures of Amina Al-Sirafi is an entertaining sea adventure-historical-fantasy of a woman pirate sailing the Arabian Gulf and Indian Ocean in the 12th century. This is the world of Sinbad the Sailor, of Ibn Battuta, of Oman’s beautiful rich naval history of seafaring dhows. Amina is also awesome! She is no plucky sassy teenage girl (the overdone protagonist of choice in this genre), but rather, she is 40-something swashbuckling pirate comfortable with herself and confident in her own abilities.The story is funny and adventurous, and moves at a great pace. The only negative that I would say is that writer (who also does this with her City of Brass series) likes to insert contemporary social/political commentary in her work. I agree with her politics (I can tell that she is quite progressive) so it is not a criticism of her political beliefs themselves, but rather the way they are presented. It is sometimes quite jarring to have modern developed political thoughts and commentary about the vagaries of the "rich folk" jump out of a rich tapestry of medieval Islamic and maritime fantasy. It's not that people of that time weren't political, but the way it is presented is not very organic.I am just so grateful to see this time and place represented and finally, a mature adult female voice enjoying herself in adventure story that's not all Kate Chopin and Sylvia Plath, or some YA fantasy romance that happens to take place in a vague historical setting. It is very clear to me that the author did a lot of research to craft this world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A pirate fantasy
reviews.reviewText: I saw this book highly recommended after reading other fantasy books. But, it was not at all what I was expecting. It is the story of a female pirate on the Indian Ocean. She and her crew set out to rescue a kidnapped girl. However, things are not as they seem, and they end up dealing with dark magic and magical creatures. This fantasy adventure story was quite the ride!The cast of characters is full of misfits and unusual skills. I enjoyed meeting them and seeing them as the family they are. This book was well written and full of exciting scenes. I did find it a challenging read because of the unknown language used and little prior background knowledge of the time, place, and religion. But if you are looking for a fantasy full of adventure, this is a good one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Came fast and in perfect shape!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Entertaining Adventure of Old
reviews.reviewText: Highly recommend if you like to be absorbed in a fantastical magical adventure of lore and legend. You won’t be disappointed!

Was awesome to have a relatably aged main character who is also a bad-arsed. I find it hard to find stories like this that are adult oriented with strong female protagonists.Enjoyed the story and all characters a lot and can't wait for the next one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As an Arab who fell in love with the sea at an early age, this book was particularly poignant for me. I can’t say I ever particularly wanted to run away and be a pirate, but I have definitely day dreamed about sailing away and going on adventures like Sindibad - or like Amina Al Sirafi.It’s always a rare thing to come across a book that uses “Eastern” mythology and history in such an authentic way whilst also spinning a captivating story. Chakraborty has managed it beautifully.I’m very much looking forward to seeing what comes next in the series.

Amina är en väldigt bra start in i fantasy för er som precis som jag nyligen började läsa igen i vuxen ålder. Charaktärerna är trovärdiga och roliga att läsa, man vill veta mer och mer om dem ju mer man läser men den som tar showen är verkligen huvudkaraktären Amina som man följer i en fisrt person perspektiv.Om ni är intresserade av en crew av karaktärer som är mycket äldre och faktiskt visar sin ålder är boken perfekt. Att läsa om en moder och se hennes perspektiv på världen var något jag verkligen gillade och hur hbtq+ karaktärerna vävdes in utan problem var också ett stort plus.Boken utspelar sig i en intressant del av världen som man oftast inte läser om i fantasy vilket kändes väldigt fresh.För att summera så rekommenderar jag starkt denna boken till alla som vill läsa om en stark äldre kvinnlig karaktär i en bit av världen man ofta inte läser om i fantasy som får gå igen prövningar i både moderskap och sin tro.

Una auténtica preciosidad. Ha venido en muy buen estado (en otras ocasiones que he comprado libros por aquí han venido golpeados o ligeramente estropeados, pero este ha llegado perfecto). La edición es una maravilla, está en inglés y tapa dura. Con muchas ganas de leerlo, he leído muy buenas opiniones del libro.

reviews.reviewTitle: Piratin nimmt noch einen letzten Auftrag an
reviews.reviewText: Eigentlich hat Aminal Al-Sirafi sich aus dem Dasein als Piratin zurückgezogen und zieht jetzt ihre Tochter groß. Doch dann bekommt sie einen Auftrag, den sie gleich aus mehreren Gründen nicht ablehnen kann. Sie trommelt (nicht ganz ohne Schwieriegkeiten) ihre ehemaligen Kameraden zusammen und sie machen sich auf in ein Abenteuer, das größer, aufregender und vielschichtiger ist, als sie es sich zunächst vorstellen können.Ich mochte, dass die Hauptcharaktere alle ein erwachsenes Leben führten, das zumindest bei Amina auch deutlich in ihre Queste hineinspielt. Das Abenteuer an sich enthält Stürme, Monster, fiese Bösewichte und nicht ganz so fiese Piraten, also alles, was zu einer Piratengeschichte gehört. Das Setting ist angeleht an das Leben der Menschen im Mittelalter um den Indischen Ozean, die fantastischen Wesen, die natürlich auch vorkommen, entstammen der islamischen Mythologie.
